thread.title: Shares slip ahead of US jobs data
thread.title_full: Shares slip ahead of US jobs data

title: Shares slip ahead of US jobs data
text:
Fri, Oct 2, 2015, 12:49 PM AEST - Australia Markets close in 3 hrs 11 mins Shares slip ahead of US jobs data AAP â€“ 11 minutes ago Print 
The share market is slightly lower as investors wait on a highly anticipated US jobs report. 
Shares recovered some ground from early losses of about one per cent, leaving the market about 0.4 per cent lower in early afternoon trade. 
Banking and resources stocks were under pressure, with all four big banks nearly one per cent lower and Rio Tinto down 1.2 per cent. 
Retail stocks including Wesfarmers, Myer and JB Hi-Fi were also lower despite data showing a slight rise in spending in August. 
US jobs figures to be released on Friday night will be closely watched as they could determine the timing of a US interest rate hike. 
KEY FACTS 
* At 1220 AEST on Friday, the benchmark S&P/ASX200 index was down 20 points, or 0.38 per cent, at 5,093 points. 
* The broader All Ordinaries index was down 17.4 points, or 0.34 per cent, at 5,126.7 points. 
* The December share price index futures contract was down five points at 5,076 points, with 19,864 contracts traded. 
* National turnover was 575 million securities worth $1.3 billion. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook
